name: id-102
title: One Directory, Still No SSO: LDAP Authentication
description: Deploy OpenLDAP and experience centralized identity without single sign-on. Users share one directory but still type passwords for every app.

hypothesis.claim: Centralizing user credentials in LDAP eliminates per-app password management but does not provide single sign-on.
questions: How does LDAP centralize user identity compared to per-app databases?
What authentication friction remains even with a central directory?
Why doesn't LDAP alone constitute single sign-on?
